content.text: Hello, I'm trying to get some feedback on my resume.
Sure, I'd be happy to help. Do you have a copy I can look at?
Yeah, let me send it over to you.
Ok, I got it. I'm taking a look now.
Great, thanks. Let me know what you think.
So, overall it looks pretty good. I like the format and the way you've organized your information.
Thanks, I'm glad you like it.

There are a few things I would recommend changing, though. First, I would add a summary statement at the top of your resume. This is a great way to highlight your skills and experience, and to give potential employers a quick overview of what you're all about.
That's a great idea, I'll do that.

Second, I would try to quantify your experience whenever possible. For example, instead of just saying that you "managed a team of employees," say that you "managed a team of 10 employees and increased sales by 15%." This will help potential employers see the value you can bring to their organization.
Finally, I would proofread your resume carefully and make sure there are no errors. This is a small detail, but it can make a big difference.
Ok, I'll do that. Thanks for all your help!
